p: In digestive systems, E. hirta preparations are used for the treatment of female disorders, worm infestation in children, pimples, gonorrhea, tumors, constipation, dysentery, jaundice, indigestion, biliousness, stercorrhagia, bloating, choleric effects, and the laxative [ 18]. For instance, a decoction of leaves or stems of E. hirta and E. lathyris is often administered as anti-diarrheal in Burundi, Philippines, China, and Nigeria [ 18, 19]. Euphorbia species have also been recognized and reported for their anticancer and anti-hepatitis B components [ 19].
